info.description: This is the Rasa X HTTP API
info.title: Rasa X HTTP API

tags.name: Models
tags.description: Your combined NLU and Core models

tags.name: Model config
tags.description: Your combined NLU and Core model config

tags.name: Conversations
tags.description: Conversations between your assistant and end users

tags.name: Messages
tags.description: Individual user messages with NLU predictions

tags.name: Users
tags.description: Users of this Rasa Enterprise instance

tags.name: Roles
tags.description: Permissions associated with Rasa Enterprise users

tags.name: Environments
tags.description: Separate environments where models can be deployed and tested by users

tags.name: Runtime config
tags.description: Runtime config containing the channel credentials and endpoint settings

tags.name: Chat Token
tags.description: Token used for sharing your assistant with testers

get.summary: Get the logs of the Rasa X service

403.description: Users can only update their own properties

404.description: The user doesn't exist

200.description: User whose password was just changed

post.description: Not recommended to be used. The frontend only supports a single project.

404.description: Project already exists

get.summary: Get a list of Rasa models
get.description: Returns a list of metadata on Rasa models. A Rasa model is a model combining a trained dialogue model with an NLU model.

404.description: No model found

400.description: An unexpected error happened when the request was processed

get.summary: Get a Rasa Core model with tag

404.description: No model found for tag
Model could not be deleted

put.description: This endpoint can be used to assign a tag to a Rasa model. The tag will be removed from any other model that might have it. The endpoint returns the assigned tag with status code 200.

404.description: Model was not found or is not compatible.

delete.summary: Delete a tag of a Rasa model
delete.description: Rasa model tags can be deleted at this endpoint.

X-Total-Count.description: Total responses ignoring limit and offset

post.summary: Parse text and create a new log entry

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: Comma-separated entities to filter on

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Comma-separated actions to filter on

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: User utterance text to filter on

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Minimum timestamp of latest user event

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: Maximum timestamp of latest user event

parameters.name: policies
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of policies used for prediction

parameters.name: maximumConfidence
parameters.description: Maximum value of the minimum action confidence

parameters.name: minimumUserMessages
parameters.description: Minimum number of user messages per conversation

parameters.name: in_training_data
parameters.description: Only show conversations that appear in the training data. If false, only show conversations not appearing in training data . If unset, show all conversations.

parameters.name: sort_by_confidence
parameters.description: Sort conversations that are not found in the training data by their minimum action confidence from high to low. Has no effect if `in_training_data` is anything other than false.

parameters.name: sort_by_latest_event_time
parameters.description: Sort conversations by their latest activity from most recent to least recent.

parameters.name: is_flagged
parameters.description: Filter for conversations which contain flagged messages.

parameters.name: exclude_self
parameters.description: Exclude currently authenticated user from conversations.

parameters.name: tags_any
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of tag IDs. Only conversations that have ANY of these tag IDs assigned to them will be included in the response.

get.summary: Fetch tracker for a conversation ID.
get.description: By default, returns the serialised tracker in its JSON representation. Returns a JSON dump as a file attachment if the `Accept: application/json` request header is specified, or a story dump for that conversation in markdown format if the `Accept: text/markdown` request header is specified.

200.description: Tracker for {conversation_id} as JSON or debug dump as file attachment

schema.description: Indicates if the content is expected to be displayed inline in the browser, that is, as a Web page or as part of a Web page, or as an attachment, that is downloaded and saved locally. `inline` if the JSON representation is requested, or `attachment;filename=<FILENAME>` if the JSON file dump or story dump is requested.

oneOf.description: Tracker for {conversation_id} as JSON. Returned if the `Accept` header remains unspecified, or its value is not one of `application/json` or `text/markdown`.
Attachment of tracker debug dump in JSON format. Returned if the the `Accept: application/json` request header is specified.

schema.description: Attachment of tracker debug dump in markdown format. Returned if the `Accept: text/markdown` request header is specified.

get.summary: Fetch a list of unique actions from all conversations
Fetch a list of unique entities from all conversations
Fetch a list of unique intents from all conversations
Fetch a list of unique Rasa Core policies in all conversations

404.description: Conversation not found

post.summary: Post a message to a conversation

404.description: Failed to send message

delete.summary: Remove a flag from a message

put.description: Corrects the intent of the message and possible adds it to the training data

mapped_to.description: Maps temporary intents to existing ones.

400.description: An error happened while correcting the message intent

200.description: Correction was successfully removed from message

400.description: An error happened while undoing the correction

200.description: All tags were successfully retrieved (including empty result)

400.description: An error happened while retrieving the tags

post.description: Assign all tags from the body of the request to the conversation. If tags donâ€™t exist yet, they will be created.

200.description: All tags were successfully assigned to a conversation

400.description: An error happened while assigning the tags

delete.description: Remove a tag from a conversation.

204.description: Tag was successfully removed from a conversation

400.description: An error happened while removing the tag from the conversation

404.description: Conversation or tag were not found

put.summary: Update events in the tracker of a conversation

400.description: The request body was invalid or an unexpected error happened when the request was processed

409.description: Tracker store for sender could not be found

post.summary: Create a new event in the tracker of a conversation

400.description: The request body was invalid or an unexpected error happened when the request was processed

409.description: Tracker store for sender could not be found

post.summary: Run an action in a conversation.

name.description: Name of the action to be executed.

policy.description: Name of the policy that predicted the action (optional).

400.description: The request body was invalid or an unexpected error happened when the request was processed

409.description: Tracker store for sender could not be found

post.summary: Predicts the next action in the conversation.

200.description: Prediction of the next action was a success

404.description: Conversation not found

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search string

parameters.name: intent
parameters.description: Intents to filter on

X-Total-Count.description: Total responses ignoring limit and offset

404.description: Example could not be saved

400.description: Wrong schema, training data could not be uploaded

get.summary: Get all regular expression training data

200.description: Regex features for the given project

400.description: Regex with same pattern already exists or invalid body.

get.summary: Get a regular expression by its id

404.description: Regex for id was not found

put.summary: Update an existing regular expression using its id

404.description: Regex for id was not found.

delete.summary: Delete a regular expression by its id

404.description: Regex for id was not found

get.summary: Get a list of lookup tables.

post.summary: Create a lookup table from an uploaded file

get.summary: Get the content of a lookup table

200.description: Elements of lookup table with items separated by newlines.

post.summary: Create a new entity synonym with mapped values

synonym_reference.description: The new text value for the entity synonym

404.description: The entity synonym could not be found

post.summary: Map new values to an entity synonym

mapped_values.description: List of entity synonym values to map

201.description: The new values mapped to the entity synonym.

400.description: One or more of the mapped values specified were repeated, or the mapped values array was empty, or one or more of the mapped values already existed, or the entity synonym could not be found

put.summary: Update an entity synonym's text value

synonym_reference.description: The new text value for the entity synonym

204.description: The entity synonym was updated successfully

400.description: An entity synonym with that value already exists

404.description: The entity synonym could not be found

delete.summary: Delete an entity synonym and all of its mapped values

204.description: The entity synonym was deleted successfully

404.description: The entity synonym could not be found

put.summary: Update a value mapped to an entity synonym

value.description: The new text value of the mapped value

204.description: The mapped value was updated successfully

400.description: A mapped value with that value already exists, or the entity synonym could not be found, or the mapped value does not exist

delete.summary: Delete a value mapped to an entity synonym

204.description: The mapped value was deleted successfully

404.description: The entity synonym could not be found, or the mapped value does not exist

get.summary: Download training examples in JSON format

200.description: Attachment of training examples in JSON

get.summary: Download training examples in markdown format

200.description: Attachment of training examples in markdown

put.summary: Update a training example by id

404.description: Training example could not be updated

delete.summary: Delete a training example by id

404.description: Training data could not be deleted

put.summary: Update a training example by id

400.description: Training example could not be found

get.description: Unique entity types present in the training data.
Intents used in training examples, domain, or temporary intents

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Template text search string

parameters.name: template
parameters.description: Templates to filter on (comma-separated)

X-Total-Count.description: Total responses ignoring limit and offset

400.description: Could not add the specified template

404.description: Template not found
Template not found

get.summary: Get responses grouped by template name.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search string

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search string

200.description: Rasa Core stories as markdown file

is_default.description: Whether this role is the default role assigned to new enterprise users

401.description: Failed to validate schema for update_role

404.description: Role does not exist
Role does not exist
Role does not exist

get.summary: Get list of users for specified role

requestBody.description: List of usernames to be be associated with role

404.description: Role does not exist

requestBody.description: List of roles to be be associated with {username}

404.description: One or more roles do not exist

post.summary: Endpoint to have a conversation with the assistant

404.description: Message send failed

put.summary: Update a bot's name and description for token

200.description: Rasa runtime configuration. This configuration contains the channel credentials and the endpoint configuration.

credentials.description: Runtime credentials config as YAML string

endpoints.description: Runtime endpoints config as YAML string

400.description: Could not fetch runtime configs from files

200.description: Saved configuration of Platform deployment environments

post.summary: Update or create a feature flag

parameters.name: store_templates
parameters.description: Specifies whether to store the templates from the uploaded domain.

404.description: Action for id was not found
Action for id was not found

post.summary: Store credentials for a Git repository

422.description: Repository creation failed due to invalid credentials

get.summary: Get information about a connected Git repository

404.description: Repository with given id was not found

put.summary: Update information for a connected Git repository

404.description: Repository with given id was not found
Repository with given id was not found

get.summary: Get the status of the Git repository

404.description: Repository with given id was not found
Branch for repository with given id was not found

201.description: Changes were successfully committed and pushed

404.description: Branch for repository with given id was not found

delete.description: Disable telemetry if Rasa X is running in server mode. After calling this endpoint, the Rasa X server must be restarted in order for the changes to take effect.

200.description: Telemetry configuration was updated, or was already disabled

400.description: If Rasa X is running in local mode.

environment.name: environment
environment.description: Deployment environment to be used in query

start.name: start
start.description: Start time. Accepts ISO-8601 format (as in the example) or Unix time.

end.name: end
end.description: End time. Accepts ISO-8601 format (as in the example) or Unix time.

window.name: window
window.description: Bin size used in the accumulation of the requested analytics result. If not specified, 10 bins are returned by default. Multiple formats are supported. A full list is available at https://pypi.org/project/pytimeparse/1.1.8/.

hash.name: hash
hash.description: MD5 hash of an NLU example's text field

entitySynonymValueId.name: entity_synonym_value_id
entitySynonymValueId.description: ID of a value mapped to the entity synonym

is_temporary.name: temporary
is_temporary.description: If `True` the query will also include temporary intents

until.name: until
until.description: Include only events with a timestamp before `until`

since.name: since
since.description: Include only events with a timestamp after `since`

history.name: history
history.description: Whether to include data before the last restart event

forceCheckout.name: force
forceCheckout.description: Whether to discard potential local changes or not

rasa_environment.name: rasa_environment
rasa_environment.description: Origin Rasa host from which messages were sent

mappedValue.name: mapped_value
mappedValue.description: Query for synonyms which have the mapped value mapped to them.

exclude_leading_action_session_start.name: exclude_leading_action_session_start
exclude_leading_action_session_start.description: Whether to exclude a leading event of type action_session_start

accept.name: Accept
accept.description: Specifies which content types, expressed as MIME types, the client is able to understand. Typically used in this API to specify the requested data format: `application/json` for json and `text/markdown` for markdown.

UnauthorizedError.description: Access token is missing or invalid

bin_width.description: Width of each bin in seconds

total_messages.description: Total number of user and bot messages

sessions_per_user.description: Average number of sessions per user

EventMetadata.description: Metadata attached to this event. Any keys and values are accepted.

latest_event_time.description: Timestamp of most recent event (in seconds)

latest_input_channel.description: Name of the input channel last used

latest_event_time.description: Timestamp of most recent event (in seconds)

latest_input_channel.description: Name of the input channel last used

intents.description: Set of intents in the conversation

actions.description: Set of actions in the conversation

minimum_action_confidence.description: Minimum action confidence in the conversation

in_training_data.description: Whether the entire conversation appear in training data

policies.description: Set of policies used in the action predictions

n_user_messages.description: Number of user messages in the conversation

has_flagged_messages.description: Whether the conversation contains flagged messages

tags.description: List of conversation tags ids assigned to this conversation

payload.description: Payload to be sent if button is clicked

Template.description: Template for a group of bot responses.

RasaCoreStory.description: Rasa Core story in Markdown format

intent_mapped_to.description: Name of the intent which the intent is mapped to. If the intent is a temporary one, it has to be mapped to an existing one to be part of the training. If its value is `null` it deletes existing mappings.

DataWarning.description: A warning tells you there are too few or too many of something. The warning will also return the `min` or `max` number that is acceptable, and the current count. For example, if you have <2 examples for one of your intents, you will receive a warning about the `dataPerIntent` with a `min` of 2 and a `count` of 1.

type.description: Entity being warned about * `data` - Training data. * `blankIntent` - Training data with blank intent values. * `intent` - Intents to which your training data are classified. * `dataPerIntent` - Training data classified to the intent specified in `meta`.

min.description: Either `min` or `max` will always be present

max.description: Either `min` or `max` will always be present

is_default.description: Whether this role is the default role assigned to new enterprise users

bot_name.description: Name of the bot to be displayed to the receiver of a shared bot

policy.description: Policy which predicted the most likely action

MismatchWarning.description: Mismatch warning of domain items that are either found in the domain or in training data, but not in both

items.description: Item mismatches that are found in training data but not in the domain
Item mismatches that are found in the domain but not in training data

DomainWarnings.description: Mismatches between training data and domain actions, intents and entities

items.description: Hashes of examples with this intent
Hashes of suggestions from the conversation logs with this intent

is_temporaray.description: If `True` the intent is a temporary intent

mapped_to.description: In case this is a temporary intent it describes whether this intent is currently mapped to another one in the training data

user_goal.description: User goal the intent is mapped to

domain_id.description: Id of domain which action belongs to

is_form.description: Indicates if action is a form

alg.description: JWT algorithm used in signing the key

number_of_elements.description: Number of elements in the lookup table

content.description: Base64-encoded content of the lookup table file

EntitySynonym.description: "Represents a particular value of an entity (like `New York` for entity `city`), to which different text values can be mapped to (like `NY` or `Manhattan`), creating synonyms."

synonym_reference.description: Text value of the entity synonym

EntitySynonymValue.description: Represents a text value mapped to an EntitySynonym.

value.description: Text value mapped to this entity synonym

id.description: ID of the value mapped to this entity synonym

nlu_examples_count.description: Number of times this mapped value is used in NLU training examples

GitRepository.description: Information about a connected Git repository

ssh_key.description: SSH key which should be used to access a private repository

git_service.description: Name of the Git service which is used

git_service_access_token.description: Access token which might be used to access the API of the Git service (e.g. to create pull requests)

target_branch.description: Name of the branch which should be pulled

GitStatus.description: Current status of the connected Git repository

is_committing_to_target_branch_allowed.description: True if committing to target branch is allowed / possible

is_remote_ahead.description: True if there are new commits on the target branch available on the remote

are_there_local_changes.description: True if there are some local changes which can be committed

current_branch.description: Branch which is currently checked out

time_of_last_pull.description: Time when the target branch was synced for the last time as unix timestamp

remote_branch.description: Describes which branch the changes were added to

committed_to_target_branch.description: Whether the changes were committed to the target branch

ModelTrainingConfirmation.description: Confirmation that model training was successful

model.description: Name of the newly trained model

id.description: ID of an already existing tag. If this property is present, then all other properties will be ignored, and this ID will be the one assigned to the conversation

value.description: Name of the tag (new or already existing one). If a tag with this name already exists, the existing tag will be assigned to the conversation. If this property is present, then "color" is also required

color.description: Hex value of the tag's color (without "#"). If this property is present, then "value" is also required

id.description: ID of an already existing tag.

color.description: Hex value of the tag's color (without "#").

items.description: IDs of conversations the tag is assigned to
